meanings.sent1: She finalises her painting by adding the last brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: He always finalises his homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef finalises the cake with a sprinkle of powdered sugar.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner finalises the race with a sprint to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle finalises with the placement of the final piece.

meanings.definition: To make a final decision or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The team finalises their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent2: After much discussion, they finalise the contract terms.
meanings.sent3: The siblings finalise their movie choice with a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The judge finalises the verdict after carefully considering all the evidence.
meanings.sent5: The committee finalises the event details after a thorough review.

meanings.definition: To bring something to an end.
meanings.sent1: The sunset finalises the day, painting the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher finalises the class by summarizing the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The magician finalises his performance with a disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The rain finalises the outdoor picnic, sending everyone running for cover.
meanings.sent5: The clock finalises the meeting, reminding everyone it's time to go.
